choices: The cousins run off to another room.
The cousins stay to bother Johnny and his friend some more.
Aunt Lesley calls the cousins into the other room.
1.content:
*knock knock knock*
*opens door*

"Ricky!" Johnny shouted. "Thank god it's you. I don't know if I could take any more surprise visitors."

"Surprise visitors?" the boy asked, holding his friend's rather heavy, fully wrapped birthday gift in both hands. "What do you mean?"

"ugh my aunt--" Johnny was cut off by a feminine voice yelling from another room.

"JOHNNY WHO IS IT AT THE DOOR?"

Johnny sighed and pitched his voice as high as hers. "JUST MY FRIEND RICKY, AUNT LESLEY."

"OK! Well let him in! You guys are letting a draft in the house by keeping that door open!" She yelled from the living room.

Johnny rolled his eyes. 'It's summer for gods sake. A little breeze of fresh air never hurt anyone...'

Ricky stepped into the house and Johnny closed the door behind him.

"Your aunt, huh?" Ricky asked, kind of bummed out.

"Yeah. My mom asked her to come over while she and my dad went and got my birthday gift...to 'watch' me. I'm old enough, I mean my god. I don't know why they needed her here."

"Maybe they just wanted more family over for your birthday, and I mean, it's also the end of the school year tomorrow too so it's kind of like a double celebration. We’re gonna be SENIORS bro aren’t you stoked?"

"I guess you’re right." Johnny sighed out, defeated. Maybe his friend was right. “Seniors.” Johnny replied giving his best friend a fist bump.

"But my annoying younger cousins are also here...."

Almost as if on cue, Ricky and Johnny heard two really loud thunderous footsteps running down the stairs.

"Hey mom!" they spoke, running by Aunt Lesley in the other room. "JOHN! JOHN!"

Ricky glanced over and saw two young boys darting towards them.

"HEY!" the blonde one shouted as he stopped and stared at Johnny.

"Wesley....You know I hate it when you call me John, it's Johnny." Johnny almost rolled his eyes to the two boys.

"Yeah yeah, whatever." The dismissive boy said.

Ricky already hated these two boys. He could tell that when Johnny said they were annoying, that was an understatement. Both were dressed in designer clothes that neither Ricky nor Johnny's parents could afford.

"What's that?" The darker haired one asked Ricky.

"It's a gi---" Ricky started.

"Well, duh. I know it's a birthday gift. It's all wrapped up." the dark haired one replied.

"Justin don't be rude to my friend, what do you two want?" Johnny replied.

"I'm not being rude. And I TOLD you not to call me Justin." The dark haired boy said.

Johnny sighed. "Ok. Fine. Juice." Johnny paused, feeling silly for calling another person after a drink. "Don't be rude to my friend, and what do you two want?"

"Welllll, JOHN." Wesley said with a smile; showing off his bracer clad yellow teeth and completely ignoring Johnny's preference of name.
"We WERE coming down here to get your laptop password, but now we kinda want to know what that gift is."

Ricky winced at the sight of Wesley's mouth.

"Yeah, what is it already?" Juice repeated.

Ricky ignored both of the boys and what they were saying, already annoyed with them.

"Do you know what a toothbrush is?" Ricky asked Wesley. "Maybe I should've brought one so you could at least see what it looks like."

"I don't remember talking to YOU, shithead." Wesley said. "I just want to know what your worthless gift is so I can get on with my life." He finished.

"Worthless gift? I'm sorry you think it's so worthless before seeing it. Give me your address and I'll mail you some toothbrushes. Trust me it would be the most useful gift you've ever gotten. I can smell your breath from here."

Johnny sighed out loud. He really wished his cousins weren't here right now.

"Who do you think you are?" Juice asked Ricky as if sizing him up and getting ready to fight.

Ricky looked over at the younger boy kind of cockeyed. 'Are these two even serious?' He wondered.

"Look all I'm saying is maybe I should've brought some sun screen because your brother's teeth are as yellow as the sun." Ricky said.

“You’re not about to have any teeth in a second, dickhead.” Juice said.

“The ONLY person who’s gonna lose any teeth here is brace face when he goes to the dentist hahahahaha!” Ricky laughed not taking Justin seriously.

"OH MY GOD WILL YOU GUYS PLEASE STOP IT!" Johnny yelled as Justin got closer to beat his friend Ricky’s ass.

Johnny wasn’t one for confrontations like this.

"Is everything ok in there?" Aunt Lesley called out.

"Yes, everything fine." Johnny replied.

"Yes mom." The boys said in unison.

"If your mom weren't here..." Ricky started.

"Ohhhhh I'm shaking." Juice said sarcastically, fake trembling.

"Fuck sakes. Look, it's none of your guy's business what the gift is and---" Johnny began, trying to deflate an escalating situation.

"Actually... can you take it off my hands right now? It's really heavy." Ricky asked.

"Sure." Johnny replied.

"Just because it's heavy doesn't mean it's any good." Wesley said in a snobbish tone.

Ricky wanted to punch the kid. 'Who WEARS a shirt that says 'supreme' anyway?' He thought.

"...Also might prevent me from smacking some brats with it..." Ricky muttered.

The weight of the gift fell into Johnny's hands.

"Are you kidding?" Johnny replied, getting a grip on the gift and taking it out of his friend's hands. "this thing is INSANELY heavy." Johnny said, having to use both hands to scoop it up onto the counter.

It made a rather loud noise as he sat it down on the counter-top.

"Whoa." Wesley said, enthralled by the gift now and ignoring Ricky.

"Dude unwrap it!" Juice added.

"He doesn't have to unwrap it now." Ricky said in annoyance. "Can't these kids go DO something." Ricky asked.

Both Juice and Wesley glared at him.

"No, it's ok. I would like to." Johnny said.

Johnny started with the bow and pulled it off. Then he pinched his fingers around the red patterned wrapping paper that read 'Happy Birthday!" with balloons everywhere all over. Johnny tore the paper down and to the right, diagonally, and as all three boys looked at the small opening in awe Ricky started to smile.
Johnny quickly tore the rest of the wrapping off and the gift lay naked before everyone to see.

"Oh." Juice said with disappointment in his voice. "It's just a rock."

"Yeah.." Wesley basically laughed "a poor persons gift. Kinda stupid."

Ricky felt personally attacked. The boys' words stung him.

"No way! It's really cool." Johnny said, defending his friend's gift. "What are these markings!?" Johnny asked.

"So my parents went on one of those archaeological digs, you know? Where you can find cool fossils and stuff? It was like the first vacation they've taken in years. They found it there while they were digging." Ricky said.

"Whoa." Johnny said, amazed. "Shouldn't this belong in a museum or something?"

"You're such a nerd." Wesley said, belittling Johnny. "And so are your rents." He continued, referring to Ricky's parents.
"It's a ROCK. It belongs outSIDE??..... you know, in the grass?...”

"Will you shut up already?" Ricky asked. He was at his wits end with these two.

"Yeah can you go find something to do?" Johnny repeated.

11.content:
"You think we want to hang out with you nerds?" Juice asked. "We. Need. THE. LAPTOP. PASSWORD. Helllllllooooooooo." He added snapping his fingers.

"It's Spiderman465 for fuck sakes, Justin." Johnny said.

"Moooooooooooooooooooom!!!" Wesley called out. "John cursed at us!"

"BE nice to my boys!!!!!!" She hollered out.

Johnny just rolled his eyes as Wesley stuck his tongue out with a "nehhhhhhhh." causing Ricky to gag once more at the sight of his filthy mouth.

"You two GAYYS have fun down here with the dirt rock." Juice said.

"We're not gay!" Johnny shouted.

"Whatever!" the two boys said in unison, as they started to run off with Juice in the front.

Johnny and Ricky watched Wesley flip the two boys the bird. Johnny replied by flipping him off as well, and that's when Wesley stopped moving mid run, to look back at the two boys. Wesley saw Johnny's finger, and so he took his own middle finger which was still flipping them off, and stuck his tongue out, patting his ass with the extended finger over and over in a mocking gay gesture while laughing. It was like he was fingering his ass with his middle finger.

"What the fuck?" Ricky asked.

Meanwhile his brother Juice, completely oblivious to all this, stopped his running streak by jumping up and hitting the patch of wall above the doorway. Wesley turned back to face forward and ran quickly to catch up with his brother. The two took off, and the boys could hear them get halfway up the stairs when Johnny and Ricky heard Aunt Lesley yell out to them.

“WHAT are you boys doing?"

"We're gonna play minecraft on John's laptop!" Wesley replied.

"DON'T BREAK ANYTHING!" His aunt reminded them. "He doesn't have as much as you boys do."

"Yeah, yeah OK." One of them yelled back.

"Oh my god!" was all Ricky could muster.

"Yeah. She doesn't help anything....I'm sorry about that." Johnny muttered, while touching the rock.
"She just sits there and watches desperate house wives while those two destroy my room. I wish she would go to the store or something. Then I'd be in charge!"

"Yeah I understand..." Ricky said. "They're brats. Oh, and annoying doesn't even begin to describe them or the throbbing headache I have right now."

Johnny laughed. He was so happy his friend understood exactly what he meant.

"What was up with that...umm...gesture, though?"

"Oh...you remember in middle school when the asshole kids discovered the word gay?...."

"Say no more." Ricky replied.

"Yeah, they've been calling me gay for years. It's like their joke or whatever."

"You mean they can't prove it!?" Ricky said, laughing at his own sarcasm.

"They WISH." Johnny replied as he was lifting up the stone to carry it.

A slight tinkle glinted the rock on the stone as he spoke, but the gleam went unnoticed.

"Alright, kids!" All the boys in the house randomly heard Lesley call out. "I have to go back to the house for a second. I forgot something REALLY important!"

"Ok, mom!" The brats upstairs replied.

Lesley walked out into the kitchen where Ricky and Johnny were.

"I forgot your birthday gift, Johnny I am SO soo sorry. I told the boys to remind me before we left, but they never did. You know how hard it is for Wesley and his ADHD.....and Justin with his...well, you know their conditions. I'm just going to go back to the house real quick, ok? You'll be fine by yourself. Honestly, you turn 17 today. I trust you." She said. "I'll be RIGHT back and you know I'm just a phone call away."

"I know. Thanks, Auntie." Johnny said.

Lesley walked out of the front door and not soon after the boys all heard a car start and pull out of the gravel driveway.

"Alright." Johnny said, grunting. "I'm going to carry this upstairs, can you go ahead and tell the brats to leave my room?"

"Gladly!" Ricky said, jogging over the stairway and going up the stairs hastily with a smile on his face while Johnny inched his way toward the staircase, weighed down by the stone.

Before walking in to his friends room, Ricky heard a muttering about something gay. 'Lame middle schoolers.' he thought to himself. He couldn't wait to tell the two brats to get out of the room, so he grabbed the knob and opened the door quickly.

"OHHhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh mannnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn." He heard Juice say while Wesley laughed.
"WE WERE RIGHT!" Juice said. The two boys were staring at the computer screen and didn't even turn their heads to acknowledge Ricky in the room.

"You two have to leave." Ricky said with authority. "Get out."

"Why?" Wesley said, with a huge smile on his face. "Are you two butt buddies coming up to have sex or something?"

"Dude we're not gay, will you shut the fuck up already?" Ricky said, his eye twitching in frustration as he listened to Wesley sip loudly on his energy drink.

"Oh yeah?” Juice asked, turning the computer screen that was sitting in his lap toward Ricky. “Then how do you explain these?"

Ricky squinted at the computer screen and what he saw left him in complete shock. His mouth opened up a little, and couldn't describe how he felt in that moment, as a wide range of emotions flooded through him. He was leaning in closer and closer to look at the images on the screen, completely unable to process the information.

"Dude, it's ok that you're a fag or whatever but don't like open your mouth, and come closer to my dick like that. It's creepy." Juice said.

Wesley started laughing. "Oh my god he totally wants to suck your dick, Juice." The laughter from Wesley increased when he heard how much funnier it sounded at the end when he said 'dick Juice'.

"I'M NOT FUCKING GAY!" Ricky shouted defensively.

"So why did you let your boyfriend take all these pictures of you!?" Wesley asked.

"Look." Juice said, "Here's one of someone’s penis."

"Oh my god..." Ricky said, looking at the photo.

It looked like Johnny opened up Ricky's pants and took a snapshot of his package. But he had no memory of that happening. Was his friend taking pictures of his privates while he was sleeping!?
Ricky glanced at some of the other photos on the screen, too, completely in shock.
In a lot of them Ricky looked like he was asleep. In some of them Ricky was in the gym shower.....naked and wet. In others someone that looked like Ricky was just bending over...

"Dude look at this one!" Wesley said with tears in his eyes from laughter. "It looks like!! --HHhaha It looks...." Wesley lost his breath and couldn't breathe enough to finish his thought.

The energy drink in his hand spilled out onto the floor as his body reacted to what he was seeing. Juice was also laughing uncontrollably at this point.
Ricky looked and he saw it. It was a picture of him, passed out. He remembered the day exactly. He was sleeping over at his friends house a year or so ago...It was a picture of Ricky, laying in the bed, and he looked like he was asleep, and someone's dick was on his face.
He immediately wanted to throw up.

The boys could hear footsteps approaching and the door opened.
Johnny stepped in and tried to quickly drop the slab of rock on top of his desk nearby, completely unaware of the atmosphere in the room.

"Jesus Christ." He said, stepping in a puddle of energy drink on the floor near the bed as he walked in the room. “Did you spill that energy drink Wesley?!”
He asked a little pissed, feeling his socks soaked in some foreign liquid.

He stepped toward his desk and dropped the stone on it. It made a loud slamming noise.

"Fuuuuck.” He said. “That thing is way too heavy. Next time you get me a gift make it a little easier to carry."

"Up your butt?" Wesley asked, laughing.

Johnny turned around and....

111.content:
"Go fuck yourself." Johnny said.

"Go fuck your butt buddy." Wesley said.

"Yeah....we're a little creeped out right now." Juice said.

"He took them without me knowing...." was the only thing Ricky replied with.

"Yeah, SUREEE he did." Juice replied.

The two boys started snickering. "Did you see the one where Ricky was dressed up in a spider-man costume?" Wesley asked.

"Hey wasn't Johnny's password Spiderman something too?" Juice asked.

Johnny turned to face everyone else and his eyes found his best friend, who was, for some reason staring at his laptop in total awe with an ashen face.

"Hey, what's going---" before he could finish his thought his cell phone started to ring and he pulled it out.
"Hello?" Johnny answered.

On the other end he could hear his Aunt Lesley's voice, frantic and in obvious distress.

"Johnny!" She all but screamed.

"Are you crying?" Johnny asked. "Are you ok Auntie?"

"I'm coming right back, RIGHT back Johnny!" Johnny heard the sound of a car horn blowing, and the sound of Aunt Lesley's engine going faster.

"What's wrong!?" Johnny asked.

All the commotion from the phone caused even Ricky to look up from the laptop. Soon all 4 of the boys were listening in on the conversation.

"I'LL BE RIGHT THERE! JUST DON'T TURN ON THE NEWS!"

Johnny immediately grabbed the tv remote from his desk and turned the news on, and turned the volume up.

"GOD DAMN IT JOHNNY I YOU NOT TO TURN THE NEWS ON!" His Aunt Leslie screamed.

He dropped his phone in total shock of what he saw.

It was his parents car....completely destroyed and rolled over at the end of a giant hill.

"Tragedy struck today when a semi-driver fell asleep behind the wheel and collided head first into a white 1990's Honda Accord, knocking the car through the railing and down into a ditch below Crestfall Hill. The semi driver came out of the accident unharmed, but the driver and passenger of the Honda died shortly after impact. The bodies have been identified as Mr. And Ms. Charlie Dewitt who were returning home with their teenage sons' birthday gift. The city is mourning their loss of life and the Mayor is currently taking up donations for the family's loss."

The screen cut over to the Mayor "This is a tragedy...."

Tears swollen out of Johnny's eyes and fell down his face. He couldn't stop crying and in doing so forgot about his wet socks, and the mess Wesley made. He even forgot about his friend in the room. His voice was quaking and snot was slowly working its way out of his nose while his body quivered in loss. He turned back around to face everyone in the room.

"My...my parents are dead." he was able to get out.

"Dude that's like, the least of your problems." Wesley said. "Like...we know you're gay, now. That's way worse."

Anger boiled up inside of Johnny.
"WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT. FOR THE LAST TIME, I'M NOT GAY!! MY PARENT'S JUST DIED SHOW SOME FUCKING RESPECT YOU PIECE OF SHIT!"

Johnny pushed Wesley, who just fell back onto the bed he was sitting on. He immediately got back up.

"Why did you take those pictures of me, Johnny?"

"Because you wanted him to?" Juice laughed.

"What pictures? My parents are dead...."

"You took naked pictures of me...." Ricky said, far more concerned with this issue.

"What?!" Johnny replied, his voice weak but alarmed.

Ricky pointed at the laptop, and Johnny's tear stained eyes looked at the content.

"Wha-? I don't know how..." Johnny said. "Oh my God! I DON'T KNOW how those got in there! I WOULD NEVER! RICKY I WOULD NEVER!"

"Ricky I would neverrrrr!" Wesley replied in a gay voice. "I promissssssssssssss I love you. You're my butt buuuuddyyy."

"Shut. Up." Ricky replied.

"No. Hey we want you two to know that we're supportive of you, just not of the butt sex you guys have." Wesley said, laughing.

"These pictures are...these need to be deleted! I DON'T KNOW HOW THEY GOT HERE!" Johnny repeated.

"Deleted? No way. We saved them, actually." Wesley said.

"Saved them?" Ricky repeated.

"Yeah...we're not like bigots or whatever... but we thought it would be helpful if we sent them out to the school and outed you guys." Wesley said.

"What!?" Ricky replied. "I'M NOT GAY! HE'S THE FUCKING FREAK!"

"Whoa! look dude, the fact is that you're in these pictures WITH him in a lot of em..." Wesley said.

"You can't OUT SOMEONE WHO ISN'T IN!" Ricky replied.

"Look...." Juice replied with a cold sounding voice..."if you two nancyboys don't want the pictures to come out, you're gonna have to help us."

"A-are you blackmailing me with those fake pictures?" Johnny asked. "My parent's just died.. I have no family left....and you're blackmailing me?"

"We are your family." Wesley replied. "And don't take it so seriously. We just want some things..."

"What the fuck are you two talking about?" Ricky asked. "Delete the photos!"

He reached over, grabbed the laptop and thew it at the wall. The laptop screen broke but it didn't cause any real permanent damage.

"Go ahead and destroy the laptop...we saved the pictures to iCloud. I can even access them in my phone." Juice said.

"HOW THE FUCK DID YOU GET THOSE PHOTOS IN ICLOUD!?" Ricky replied.

"It was like the first thing we did, duh." Wesley replied.

"If I were you two I'd be more worried about what we want..." Juice said.

"What do you fucking want!?" Ricky asked, freaking out.

"Well, that stone for starters." Juice said.

"Fucking take the stone! YOU CAN HAVE THE STONE!" Ricky said.

"Just take the stone." Johnny replied.

"That's not all we want."

"What more can you fucking want?!" Johnny screamed. "I DON'T HAVE ANYTHING LEFT!" tears started streaming down his face.

"Quit being such a queen." Juice replied. "It's not a big deal..and you still have us, even if you are a queer."

"I'M NOT FUCKING QUEER!" Johnny shouted. "YOU CAN'T SEND THOSE PHOTOS OUT! THEY'RE A LIE!"

"Well...if you really don't want us to send them out... I'm sure we can come to some kind of arrangement..." Juice said, looking at his brother Wesley.

"What kind of arrangement!?" Ricky asked.

1122.content:
Suddenly Johnny's head felt like it was splitting open. The whole room was spinning and he had to grab hold of the desk, until his grip was lost and he fell down to the floor. He could feel the wood of his desk against the back of his neck. He heard a loud thumping noise near off, but before he could look over he lost his vision and his hearing. He knew he lost his hearing because he was yelling for help, but couldn't hear it. He could only feel the hardwood floor beneath him, so he kept shouting. He kept shouting and shouting, even as the feel of the desk pressed against his neck also faded away, and he was left with nothing but the floor beneath him.

He wondered if this is what death felt like. Would the floor disappear from his senses soon too, and he be left with nothing? He was hoping his friend would call an ambulance and after shouting a few times but being unable to hear his own voice he gave up. He was feeling sharp, unbelievable pain coursing throughout his body to the point where his body was having a spasm fit beyond his control...but yet he was cognizant enough to understand he was probably having a seizure.

When his vision returned his ears rang for a few seconds and he was staring up at what looked like his dresser. The size of it was really distorted though, or so Johnny thought. When he pulled himself to set up, he thought his eyes were fooling him. Underneath his bed, he could see an old discarded shoe of his from a few years back, laying there scuffed up and forgotten. He was only HALF of the shoes HEIGHT sitting up!

He couldn't have been more than 4 inches tall!

"What. the. fuck?" He heard a familiar voice shout from near the doorway.

"WHAT THE FUCK!?!" He heard again, this time more intense. Johnny turned his head toward where the noise was coming from and found himself looking at his best friend Ricky, who was the same size as him.

"What happ--" Johnny's concern was interrupted by a loud noise downstairs.

The two boys suddenly heard loud-thunder booming just outside the half-open door.

"Johnnnyy?" A young, masculine voice called from the hallway leading to his room.

"SHIT!" Johnny shouted. "HIDE!" both Johnny and Ricky made a dash for underneath the bed.

"Where'd dipshit Dewitt go?" Wesley asked.

"I don't know, probably ran off with his boyfriend after hearing the news." Juice replied, kicking Johnny's laptop across the room.

"I think it's so stupid we have to be here. Can't we just call mom and tell her he's not here?" Wesley asked.

"No. I think we have to help him or whatever." Juice replied.

"Wait....does this mean he's coming to live with us?" Wesley asked.

"Oh fuck." Juice said, flopping his ass on the bed and making it quake above the two tiny grown men, cowering underneath it.

He stretched his body out on the bed and in doing so, his feet were dangling off the edge just enough so Johnny and Ricky could see the dirt in the treads of his shoe as he rocked his feet back and forth, playfully pounding them against the bed itself.

"I don't want that faggot living with us."

"ME EITHER!!!!" Wesley shouted, slamming his foot down hard on Johnny's laptop, which made a snapping sound.

"Those bastards!" Johnny whispered out-loud, praying he was quiet enough that they didn't hear him.

He felt Ricky grab his shoulder from behind.

"What happened to us." He whispered to Johnny.

"I don't know..." Johnny replied as the two giants above them continued to have a conversation amongst themselves.

"I'll have to put a lock on my underwear drawer." Wesley said, talking to Juice above them. "I don't want to walk in one day and see my fag cousin sniffing them or some weird shit."

"Yeah, he'll probably be taking pictures of us in the shower or something like he did to Ricky." Juice replied.

"You don't actually believe that Ricky isn't a faggot too, do you?" Wesley asked.

Unseen by the two boys below the bed, Juice shrugged.
Johnny and Ricky tried to keep having a conversation, but the two boy's high-pitched and extremely loud voices always interrupted it.

"It had to be that stone, Johnny!" Ricky whispered in an intense voice. "That's the only thing that makes any sense!"

Johnny thought about it for a second. "You're right." He realized. "I was touching it when we shrank....so that means all we have to do is wait for them to leave, and try to get up to the stone."

"Probably just some mice or something, this place is gross. I don't know how John lives like this."

112232.content:
"You don't understand! THEY'RE EVIL, AND TOTAL BRATS!" Johnny shouted, grabbing his friend's arm and pulling it back.

Ricky turned around, tugged his arm free from Johnny's grip and with all his power, he pushed his friend onto the floor who fell back and hit his head, then Ricky booked it. He ran for his life toward the 4 dirty, but giant sets of shoes in front of him.

He finally got out into the open and waved, screaming "Help me!"

Johnny was already in a lot of pain, and hitting the ground didn't help. He lifted his neck up, rubbing the back of it when he heard a thunderous surprised voice.

"What the?" Wesley said, looking down at a miniature Ricky.

A look of intrigue was visible on the young boy's features. Then a quick smirk flickered across Wesley's face exposing his braces briefly before they disappeared behind his closed lips. Ricky didn't seem to notice that Wesley was holding back a smile.

"Ricky?" Juice's voice asked.

Johnny watched in horror as a giant hand reached down and snatched his friend up, lifting him beyond view. "Duuuuude, is this even real?" He heard Wesley's voice say, as the boy began poking Ricky all over.
Johnny was unable to hear his friend from this distance, but the booming voice of his two cousins were more than audible. "You have to help me!" Ricky said.

"Help you?" Johnny heard Juice ask.

"What happened?" Wesley followed up.

"IT WAS THE STONE! Johnny was touching the stone!! AND IT CHANGED US SOMEHOW! YOU HAVE TO HELP US!" Ricky cried out.

"John was touching the stone?" Wesley asked, and John felt the blood drain out of his face.

'WHY WOULD YOU TELL THEM THAT!?!' His physique screamed.

"Hmmmm.." with the tiny in one hand, Wesley pulled out his cellphone in the other, wondering if google could help him figure all this out.

He completely ignored the screams of the annoying man in his right hand as he googled the phrase "magical stones".

"YOU HAVE TO HELP ME!? AREN'T YOU GOING TO HELP ME!?" Ricky shouted.

"You said John touched the stone...where is John?" Johnny heard Juice ask.

"He's hiding underneath the bed! Help me!" Ricky said, frantic.

'Don't tell him, don't tell him!' Johnny thought to himself. 'Please don't tell him!' Johnny began biting his nails, unaware that his best friend had already sold him out; his voice too small to hear from this distance.

Johnny watched Juice get up, and his shoes were facing to the left of Johnny's vision. He saw the giant blue sneakers creak the floorboards beneath them with every step. Johnny, a grown young man, trembled as Justin's sneakers leaned onto their toes, causing them to crinkle, and the colossal boy's butt lowered closer to the ground..

"Ohhhhh Joohhhhnnnnn?" Juice called out, bending down.

Crouching that way, Justin's huge face would be next to make an appearance before Johnny. His breath caught in his throat as the giant's big, boyish, mischievous face loomed over him. His eyes locked onto Johnny for a few seconds before his lips curled in a devious grin that gave Johnny the chills. (1)

Johnny laid there, frozen in absolute terror as the giant boy reached out, extending his arm toward him. Justin's giant hand overshadowed Johnny's whole body, and came crashing down, coiling itself around his legs. Justin pulled Johnny out from under the bed, with only a light grip on Johnny's legs. The poor young man's head rubbed harshly against the hardwood floor underneath, even thudding against it with every crack that he was pulled over. Within an instant he was looking straight up at the God-Like form of his bratty younger cousin.

"What's the matter John?" Juice asked with that same villainous grin, as he tilted his head to the left. "Didn't you want to come out and play?" He asked.

Ricky heard something coming from the hallway, and Justin popped in through the door with 2 pairs of shoes in hand and a few rolls of paper towels hanging on his arm. he dropped all of it to the floor immediately, the shoes flying every which direction. Ricky got a good look at the soles of the shoes and gagged. He saw the shoes littered with bug corpses and grass. One pair even had a giant wad of gum under them.

Wesley just flipped his brother off.

He stepped over to the middle of the room where the paper towels and shoes were and sat him on the floor.

"You know what your job is." Justin said.

"Yes.... I'll clean your guys shoes and you grow me back." Ricky said.

"Right. For revenge." Justin added.

"So, what?" Wesley asked. "Are you gonna kill John when you see him?"

"I'm still thinking about it." Ricky said.

"Hahaha." Wesley laughed.

He got on his knees, bent over and then went on all fours so he could get in Ricky's face.

"Well with how dirty our shoes are, you're gonna have A LONG time to think about it." He said with a smile, flashing his yellow teeth.

Ricky tried not to gag as Wesley's foul breath permeated the air. He didn't want to seem rude to the person who was going to help grow him back.

"Haha." Ricky faked a laugh. "You're right." Ricky replied.

"Yeah." Ricky decided. "I'm just going to wait here for them to come back. They said they'd check up on me, right?" Ricky decided. He lay down and stare at the ceiling.

"They're understanding." He told himself. "It will all work out." Ricky started imagining how great it would feel to be big again, and take his revenge out on John.

"They were right, if you want to punish someone do it with shit. I'm glad I'm not on their bad side, so they don't use shit to punish me. I mean, holy fuck, dog shit smells so disgusting.. I can't wait for John to EAT mine."

"Hahahahahahah!" He laughed maniacally.

"He looks like he ate shit last night." Juice said non-chalantly. Wesley started laughing out-loud.

Lesley slapped the back of Justin's head. "JUSTIN!" She said.

"Sorry Aunt Lesley..." Johnny said. "I--I was up crying all night."

Aunt Lesley reached over and slapped the back of Justin's head again for good measure.

She reached out and rubbed his left cheek. "Here sweetie, take this pill. I don't have any water but this will help if you can just swallow it."

"...he can swallow that and more..." Wesley muttered under his breath.

Justin rolled his eyes. "Mommmmmmm I know THAT." Justin said. "WHERE is the funeral?"

Now Johnny was able to see where the boys got some of their smart ass attitudes and he hated it. Hated to see Lesley speak like that with them. He knew she thought it was only a joke, but that's the exact same kind of attitude they had all the time, a learned behavior from her and while she was kidding, they were serious.

"It's at Gentle Heart Burial Grounds. They have a funeral home and the grave site at the same location. We won't be having an open casket but we'll be having a service where we all talk for a bit inside the home and then we'll just go outside to the burial site." Lesley said.

He leaned over to whisper in Johnny's ear and his breath escaped his mouth as it opened.

PFFFFFFFFFFFFFRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT

"---fart burial grounds." He said with a smile.

After a few moments the entire family was gagging in disgust as Wesley's stinky gas filled the vehicle.

"Gross!" Juice yelled. "Mom, roll down my damn window it fucking stinks back here!"

"Sorry!" Wesley says.

"JUSTIN! Language!" Lesley yelled, undoing the child locks.

Justin rolled his window all the way down, getting a breath of fresh air.
Wesley, still grinning brought his lips next to Johnny's ear again.

"Pssst. I'm sorry you couldn't smell that one up close babe. But don't worry, your friend really seemed to enjoy it." He said, referring to Ricky who was still squirming somewhere up his ass.

"Why don't you let him go? He has nothing to do with this you don't even know him." Johnny whispered.

"WHAT!?" Wesley yelled out loud on purpose. "I'M SORRY JOHNNY I COULDN'T HEAR YOU!"

Johnny had to think fast because he couldn't jeopardize them but now he had to come up with an excuse as to why he was whispering to Wesley.

"Nothing it wasn't important, sorry." Johnny said.

"Boys we're here..." Lesley said, pulling into the funeral home's parking space. She put the car in park and looked back at Johnny.

"Johnny get your eyes off the phone and look up at me please." She said with a sigh. "I want to explain a few things before we go in here..."

"Ok." Johnny said.

"Remember how I told you that when you disappeared I made these arrangements quickly so that you would show up to the funeral?" Lesley asked.

"Yes, I remember our talk." Johnny replied, having felt grateful that Lesley would go to such lengths to find Johnny.

"Ok, well..I didn't know what kind of funeral my sister wanted, or what kind you would have preferred for them. So the arrangements I made...your parents have been cremated. I figured it was best due to their....injuries not to have an open casket viewing and cremation is better for the environment...usually anyway. The problem was I didn't know if you wanted a gravesite to visit so I bought a cremation monument. It's kind of like a tombstone but with......their ashes in it. That way you can always visit if you want to. I have half of their ashes in the monument and half of their ashes in two small urns for you. I hope that's ok, sweetie...I didn't know how else to... Johnny?" Lesley asked, looking at the tears streaming down his face.

"It's fine, thank you Aunt Lesley." He cried. "They wanted to be buried but...I don't think it matters much to them anymore."

Lesley looked at him and tears started welling up in her eyes. She reached out and gently grabbed his chin.

"I am SO sorry Johnny. I didn't know they wanted to be buried. I would never disrespect....I just..." tears started flowing out of her eyes now.

"No! Don't apologize it's fine I'm not crying because they didn't get buried. I'm crying because...."

*DING* Wesley text Johnny and Juice "Because I'm gaaaaaayyyyyyyy." - Wesley

"of everything you went through to make this special. Thank you so much! I appreciate all the thought you put into this, and them having a tombstone or a monument...that's close enough to being buried. Thank you."

Lesley sniffed loudly, pulling out a hankerchief and cleaning her eyes.

"Don't thank me. It pains me that they're both gone." *SNIIFFFF*

"So Johnny the funeral will begin with the family meeting up in this funeral home. There's a kind of wake...just family photos being shown on the screen. There will be a point for anyone to speak if they want..I have a priest who will say a prayer, I know your father was religious. Then we will all visit the grave to see the monument. I'll give you your parent's urns after the funeral." Lesley said. She then looked at Wesley and Justin "and YOU TWO. I want you on your best behaviors. NO COMPLAINING. Show respect and maybe go speak with some of the family or just try to stay away from everyone."

"Yes mom." The boys said in unison.

Lesley got out of the car first, the boys following suit. Lesley was walking up to the door of the funeral home when another adult stopped her. "I am so sorry for your loss." the adult said.
Lesley appeared to be having a conversation with her as the boys started to walk up to the door
as well.

"Funerals are so borrrrring." Wesley said out-loud next to Johnny as they walked together. "How long do we have to be here?"

"Until the service ends." Juice said.

"Awwwwwww man! Did you bring the stone? Can we just wish this to end please?" Wesley asked.

"I didn't bring it." Juice told him.

Johnny thought about telling Wesley to respect his dead parent's funeral...but he didn't bother. He knew whatever he said would fall on deaf ears and he was more interested in seeing who in the family all came, and who he could talk to.
Johnny and the boys walked into the funeral home, passing Aunt Lesley who was still speaking to that same adult outside.

"Go on in." Lesley told the boys, so they did.

1122325123321311311213111111113111211121.content:
When Johnny stepped inside his hairs stood up on end as he looked around the room, tears welled up in his eyes again and he was having a hard time breathing.

'Aunt Lesley said she threw a lot of money at this...but this is something else....' Johnny thought to himself.

He looked around the massive room and found most of his relatives were here. All of them, in
fact. There was no TV showing pictures as she said, instead it was a giant projector screen. Photos of his parent's at their wedding day flashed by, photos of them with a baby Johnny. Treasured family photos were playing slide after slide.
There was a pianist softly playing a melody and there were tables and tables of food.
A few people Johnny didn't recognize were standing near the doorway blocking the path.

Several of them apologized and when they saw him and how ragged he looked they several said "Sorry for your loss."

On the third person to so, Wesley just rudely sighed and said "He has pink eye he's not crying or whatever."

After hearing that most of the crowd backed away from Johnny.

"And it's not a big deal for just him I was related to them too...right?" Wesley asked.

He was legitimately asking a question but everyone around him assumed he meant it in a rude, snarky way. Then everyone started apologizing to him and that they were sorry for HIS loss.

"Ya, I'm sorry for my loss too...wait a minute." Wesley said, looking around the room.

"Sweet! Finally this funeral isn't such a downer!" Wesley said, a few of the relatives heard him and gave him a strange look that Wesley either ignored or didn't notice.

Instead, Wesley dashed for the food table and grabbed a plate, throwing different foods on it faster than greased lightning.

Wesley started eating what was on his plate as he walked back over to Johnny and Juice.
He grabbed some chips and threw them in his mouth chomping down on them. His mouth opened as he
was chewing.

"You guys wanna sit down? Standing here by the door seems stupid." Wesley asked.

Justin shrugged. "Sure why not. Why don't you join us, Johnny."

Wesley turned to look at Johnny.

"Yeah Johnny...." *bbbbuuuuuuuuuuurrrrrrrrrrp* "why don't you join us?"

The boys found three seats near by that were next to each other. Wesley bent over to sit down, but something in the corner caught his eye.

"OH no way! They have drinks too!" He said gleefully. He straightened his back.

"Here hold this!" He said, giving his plate to Johnny and unintentionally mind controlling him to hold the plastic plate as he walked away.

"Sorry he's being so disrespectful..." Juice said with a smirk.

"Yeah...sure you are." Johnny replied.

"What?" Juice asked. "Hey I helped plan parts of this funeral. This is a big deal to me."

"Whatever." Johnny said. "Can't you guys just...let me speak to my family? Please? You can't be so cruel that you're going to take that away from me."
Juice put his arm around Johnny's shoulder with a big grin.

"We ARE your family, Johnny." He said. "and I'm here for you if you need to talk, about
ANYTHING. Feelings of remorse... regret... being in the closet. Whatever you want. It's what your parents would have wanted from me."

"What my parent's..." Johnny started to rage. "Would've wanted? Don't pretend like you planned this funeral, this was all Lesley you didn't do ANYTHING." He shouted, and a few family members who heard him looked over at him. Johnny had to apologize out-loud to Juice so he didn't look like an asshole.

Then after everyone turned away he looked at Justin and his face turned red with anger.

"You didn't do SHIT!" he whispered.

"I did. Stop saying that. You're going to make me cry." Juice said with a completely blank expression.

"EARLIER today you said that we were coming here to CELEBRATE my parents death and NOW you're acting like you're their fucking representative. I HATE you so much you pompous little shit!" Johnny said, his anger getting worse and worse.

"We ARE here to celebrate your parents death. You SHOULD celebrate death, not mourn it you fucking tard." Juice said.

"Your parents were important to me but not to you I guess." Juice said.
Before Johnny could reply he got a tap on his shoulder and turned to see Wesley who had another plate in his hands and a drink as well.

"Here can you hold this too?" Wesley asked, holding out the drink in his hands.

Johnny was forced now to hold the plate and the drink for Wesley.

"Thanks!" he said, sitting down on a long forgotten about Ricky who was still lodged in his ass crack completely unseen.

"So whose funeral was this again?" Wesley asked, leaning over to look at his brother Juice who was sitting on the other side of Johnny.

"My parents." Johnny said.

"Oh, sorry." Wesley said. "I knew it was someone related to me but honestly I didn't listen to a word mom said in the car." He admitted, throwing more chips into his mouth that started crunching real loudly.

"So who are they?" Wesley asked. “Were they the ugly ones with the big noses or?”

“No...Wesley…” Juice said.

“Look all I know is I don’t see the ugly people with the big noses here. I always see them.” Wesley whispered.

“Wesley, we watched the video at the house remember?”

“Umm..y-yeah… I mean kind of. It’s not like I remember their faces.” Wesley said.
Juice sighed.

"There are pictures RIGHT there." Johnny said, wishing he could get up and go interact with his family. He could see other members of his distant family he recognized from a distance and wouldn't mind seeing again but they were on the other side of the room.

"Hmmm....I see the pictures..." Wesley said. "But I can't place them...." Wesley said.
Johnny was stunned. "What? you came over to our house a lot..." he said.

"Yeah, well I remember you because you're annoying. But I don't remember them too well...." Wesley said.

"It's YOUR AUNT and UNCLE! That woman, my mother, is literally your mother's SISTER. How do you NOT remember?!" Johnny asked, annoyed.

"Geez! Calm down! I don't know why I don't remember them I just don't really. They look familiar but...." Wesley started.
"You're fucking retarded if you can't--" Johnny was cut off by Wesley.

"Hey Siri who is Benjamin and Mary Anne Dewitt?" Wesley asked his phone.

"OK. I found something on the web for 'who is Benjamin and boot it.' Take a look." Siri responded.

"STUPID phone!" Wesley said in aggravation. "Hey siri!" He yelled louder.

"Never mind Siri." Juice said loud enough for the phone to hear.

"If you say." Siri responded, shutting off.

"Wesley, it's Johnny's parent's...you remember the ones who gave us those remote controlled monster trucks that one Christmas forever ago?" Juice reminded.

"OOHHHHHHH them?" Wesley asked, immediately remembering now. "Meh, those things weren't as cool
as the commercials made them seem?" He said.

"Remember how the commercials were saying how cool they were? They had that one with the flames painted on it and the other with skulls and stuff. We played with them for like 5 minutes. If that's their best I guess these two aren't a real loss, right?"

Johnny was seething. "They're still my parents you jackass!" Johnny said.

"Oh yeah yeah right, I knew that." Wesley said.

"So you remember the gift but not the people who got it for you?" Johnny asked.

"No I remember them now, kind of... I was just--"

"You kind of remember my parents?...They bought you the cool monster trucks and sent them to your house as a gift....I wanted those too, and never got one." Johnny said.
Wesley kind of snorted, laughing at Johnny.

"Well you dodged a bullet because they sucked." Wesley said. "I've always had more fun with action figures..." Wesley said out-loud.

After he said that it was like a light bulb went off for him in his mind, because his whole demeanor even down to the look on his face changed. Wesley got up out of his seat slightly, lifting his butt off of it by about 2 inches, then he sat back down. He did that a few times, clearly having just remembered Ricky's presence from the conversation he was having.

Johnny saw how Wesley was rubbing his ass against the seat ever so slightly.

"Action figures have always been wayyyy more fun." He said with a hint of pleasure in his voice.

"Drink." was all Wesley said. Johnny looked over at him wondering what he meant.

"DRRRRINKKKKKKKKKKKKKKKKKKK." he said again, giving Johnny an annoyed look. Johnny handed the drink over to Wesley who took a few sips and handed it back to him.

"Hey I'm going to go get some food too." Juice said out-loud. "Back in a minute." Juice walked up and out of the row of seats.

One of the funeral home workers who was rushing around walked into Juice, almost knocking him down.

"What the HELL?!" Juice said in response.

"I am so sorry!" The worker said.

"Show some respect!" Juice said. "My aunt and uncle just died!" He said.

"I am so sorry for your loss I didn't mean--"

"No, you didn't." Juice said, walking away.

"God damn it I wanted him to take this plate for me but forgot to ask. Here switch me." Wesley said, handing the empty plate to Johnny and taking the full one he had in his hand.

"Good thing you ate first thing this morning and don't have to worry about any of this food here, huh?" Wesley asked with a smirk, referring to his shit. "Come to think of it you don't have to drink anything either hahahaha!"

Johnny bit his tongue and prayed Lesley would stop mingling and come sit down next to them already so he wouldn't have to hear Wesley's annoying teenage voice remind him of how he ate Wesley's shit this morning.

"Nothing to say?" Wesley asked, snorting.

A few more seconds of awkward silence went by.

"Good boyyyyyyyyy." He said, patting Johnny's head. "That's a good Puffy dog."

"Get your hand off me." Johnny said.

"Or what?" Wesley said, continuing to pat him on the head like some animal.

"You'll find out." Johnny said.

"D'aaaaaawwwwwww you're so cute when you're angry." Wesley said, patting Johnny one last time and removing his hand.

'That's what I thought.' Johnny thought to himself. 'Take your hand and get it away from me.'

"You'll find out later when we go home that you're not the one in charge." Wesley said with that same smirk.

"Juice told me in a text what you did upstairs with the stone...." Wesley told him with a few short laughs.

"He has something planned for you when we get home." Wesley told him.

1122325123321311311213111111113111211121.content:
"I don't care." Johnny said.

"Ok, well, I'm sure you two will have fun. I know we will later on..." Wesley said.

"Can you just shut up, please?" Johnny asked.

"Your best 'friend'" Wesley made a mocking quotation marks gesture "is having fun RIGHT
now...." he said, rubbing his ass on the seat again.

"Shut up." was all Johnny could say at this point. "Stop doing that.." Johnny asked.

"Doinnng whaaaaaat?" Wesley asked, playing innocent as his ass rubbing against the chair became more intense.

"Stop doing that to him! He doesn't deserve it!" Johnny said.

"You have your own toys doggie, don't tell me how to play with mine." Wesley said.

"He's not your---your toy..." Johnny told him. "and I'm not your dog."

"Took you a minute to say that last part, didn't it?" Wesley said, patting Johnny on the head again.

Johnny was seconds away from blowing up at his own parent's funeral when Juice finally came back with his food.

"I think the priest is going to start his part soon, then the speeches will open up for family." Juice said.

"Ugh, lame." Wesley said. "Can we not just leave?"

"No we can't." Justin said. "This is important, Wesley."

Johnny was holding back his rage. He hated how Justin was still pretending that this all meant something to him somehow.

"Excuse me, everyone." The priest said, drawing everyone's attention. "Let's please all have a seat. I'd like to say a prayer and then open the floor up to any family member who would like to share their memories with the rest of us."

Aunt Lesley came over, shifting through the row and walking past all the boys, taking her seat to the left of Justin.

"I see you boys had some food. Did you eat, Johnny?" She asked, concerned.

"He had a big meal this morning." Wesley snorted.

"What? I didn't see him eat this morning." Lesley said.

Wesley was at a loss. He didn't think about the fact that his mother would've noticed if he
ate.

"OH uhhh I might be thinking of yesterday." Wesley said.

"You have to eat something, Johnny." Lesley told him. Johnny's stomach felt upset, it was still churning the shit and diarrhea from this morning. Even thinking about food made Johnny want to throw up.

"I will." He falsely promised in an attempt to change the conversation.

"It looks like everyone is seated. If you may all bow your heads, I'd like to lead us in a prayer.
We are gathered here today to mourn the loss of Benjamin and Mary Anne Dewitt." The Priest began.

The whole family bowed their heads and listened to his prayer, but Wesley had his phone on
while everyone else had their eyes closed. Johnny saw the light in his eyes and he said "Please put your phone away."

Lesley eye's snapped open. "Wesley!" she whispered intensely.

"Wesley put the phone away." Justin added. "This is your Aunt and Uncle's funeral! Grandma Betsy would have a cow if you---"

"WILL YOU SHUT UP!" Johnny yelled out-loud, stopping the priest dead in his tracks. "STOP
ACTING LIKE THIS FUNERAL IS IMPORTANT TO YOU!" Johnny told Justin.

All of the relatives, the whole gathering now had their eyes set on Lesley, Johnny, Juice and Wesley.

"It is important it's my Aunt and Uncle's---" Juice started.

"SHUT UP! JUST SHUT UP!!!!! YOU DIDN'T CARE ABOUT THEM!" Johnny shouted. People gasped and were murmuring in the crowd. People who didn't know were trying to figure out who was speaking and people who did know were shaking their heads.

"U-um..." the Priest said, unable to determine what to do in this situation.

"They are! They ARE important to me, Johnny!" Juice yelled back with crocodile tears in his eyes.

"NO THEY WEREN'T STOP LYING!" Johnny yelled, feeling everyone's judgey eyes on him.

Lesley was stunned. She didn't know what to do she just sat there, staring at Johnny. She wasn't sure if she should hit him at his own parent's funeral or if she should let this blow over. Her mind was completely blank.
Juice got up and ran through the row of people, running out of the room and to the bathroom with fake tears in his eyes, purposefully causing a big scene.
"Johnny!" Lesley shouted, slapping him hard. She then gasped at her own action, covering her mouth with her hands.

Johnny couldn't believe Justin had ran off crying. He was such a fake!

"Justin helped me plan this whole funeral." Lesley told him. Her words shook Johnny to the core.

"He really cared for his 'Uncle Benji' and 'Auntie Mary'. He always did!" Lesley told him.

"You made a scene in front of everyone, why would do you that!?" Lesley told him.

"I'm sorry everyone, please go on Father." Lesley said.

The priest cleared his throat. "Ermherrrmm Right." The priest continued reading the prayer from his bible and Lesley whispered to Johnny. "You had no right....NO right to make Justin feel like that. He has always loved your parents."

Johnny started to become confused, listening to Lesley. Did Justin really always love his mom and dad? Johnny wondered, thinking back. No he couldn't of right? Didn't he call them losers? Or did he just say that to look cool? Was he really that close with them? Truth be told Johnny had no idea because whenever the cousins would visit or whenever his family came to visit he did whatever was in his power to avoid them at all costs. Only interacting when absolutely necessary - like when an adult requested that they spend time together.

Johnny watched from above as 4 tiny little cages materialized out of thin air on the floor below, right next to Ricky's cage.

"Mom? Dad?" Ricky asked.

Two tiny people in separated cages turned around, hearing a familiar voice.

The woman began weeping.

"Ricky?" she asked, looking at her son in a cage not far from hers. "Ricky is that you!?"

"We thought you were missing son!" Ricky's father said.

Both of the parent's blinded by love for their son were almost completely oblivious to their surroundings, but their teenage daughter was not. She let out a blood curdling scream.

"AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!! " She screamed, pointing up toward the dark haired teenage boy who was towering over all of them.

Suddenly the atmosphere in the room became darker.

He had an aura about him that was completely different from the son or brother they once knew and loved. They could see purple bags under his eyes, and an expression of pure horror and worry. Anxiety was written all over his face and his body and even voice trembled, even though the words he had spoken were positive ones. He didn't look like the brother or son they've known their whole lives. He changed. He wasn't even looking directly at them when he was speaking.

"Master Juice has always been kind to me." Ricky said in a voice that sent a chill down everyone's spine.

"Johnny?" Ricky's mother asked, having turned around in her cage and seeing him sitting there on the bed, normal sized and staring down at them.

"JOHNNY WHO IS THAT!?" She asked, pointing toward Juice. "Johnny HELP US!!!" She cried, having already sensed her son was not well.

But Johnny sat still, unable to move. Hearing his best friend's mother's voice crying for help was tormenting him on a level that couldn't be explained.

"Johnny!?" She asked again, her scared voice ringing through his ears and shattering his thoughts into a million pieces.

"Master Juice has always been kind to me." Ricky repeated out-loud.

"LET US GO!" Ricky's father yelled up at Juice who stare down at him like an insect.

Juice ignored everyone's reactions and smiled down at Ricky's crying family.... at his feet like bugs. He bent over, reaching for Ricky's brother's cage.

No teenager should have this much power. Let alone THESE two teenagers, Johnny thought.

Juice and Wesley arrived home. Much to Johnny’s dismay Aunt Lesley didn’t recognize him just as his cousins had wanted. The two casually spoke with her, with ‘Puffy’ on a leash right in front of her and she didn’t even bat an eye. Victorious, the two brats prepared themselves for bed. Wesley pulled Ricky out of the tight space between his cheeks and put him back in his cage to be forgotten.

Before Johnny knew it, it was time to sleep with the boy he loathed so much.

info.brief_description: 4 young men find a magical stone that grants wishes. Unfortunately, they hate one another.
info.description:
Description:

In modern day America a teenager named Johnny Dewitt lives an impoverished, yet satisfactory life....until something terrible happens. He, like every average teenager, suffers greatly from his own anxiety-laden thoughts during his High School years. Although he is mostly anxious, he works as hard as he can to keep up his grades so that he can come home to his loving parents and make them proud. His best friend Richard Brown, or Ricky B for short, is the only means of coping poor young John has.

Fortunately, Johnny's birthday (June 20th) marks the end of the school year and is steadfast approaching -- it is TOMORROW, in fact! With next year being his last and marking the end of this nightmare known as high school, Johnny dreams of graduation and College grandeur. Young Johnny’s only goal right now is to become a senior, then finally finish out his High School career as a student with remarkable grades. Everyone is sure this boy will make something of himself, and be the first in his family to lead an exceptional life. His parents couldn't be prouder, and his friend couldn't be more supportive.

With the second to last day of his Junior year of High School over and done, Johnny's closest friend Ricky B comes over to visit his house with the only gift he could procure; one that even Ricky finds to be unworthy. Yet the gift soon proves to be more than intriguing....and as the boys discover the secrets to a gift that at first caused disinterest, poor Johnny receives some soul-crushing news.

Main Character Name: Johnny Dewitt

Supporting Character Name: Ricky Brown (Johnny's best Friend)

Antagonists: Johnny's two bratty cousins

Name: Wesley Uttridge Goodwin
Description: Hyper/Jokester/Prankster/Pouty “No Fair I want one!” attitude.

The cousins may or may not discover The Philosopher's Stone, a magical wishing stone so that other forms of torture may be added to the story such as: shrinking, mind control, transformation, etc.

Try not to be too descriptive of the characters so that the reader can imagine the characters as they wish, or how they interpret them to be. This goes for both age and certain characteristics.

No females. Unless they are mentioned but not actually present.

Use spell check and do your best to write a good addition. I reserve the right to delete chapters that I think are broken.

This is a dark, horror erotica focused around humiliation. Please do not even attempt to read it unless you enjoy those kinds of things. You've been warned.
